meanings.definition: To interpret in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reinterpret the painting by looking at it from a different angle.
meanings.sent2: Artists often reinterpret classic stories to create new and exciting works.
meanings.sent3: The magician's reinterpretation of the traditional card trick left the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her reinterpretation of the data shed light on a new perspective for the research team.
meanings.sent5: The reinterpretation of the song with a jazz twist gave it a fresh and modern feel.

meanings.definition: The action of interpreting something again.
meanings.sent1: The reinterpretation of the ancient text provided new insights into its meaning.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often engage in reinterpretation of historical events to gain a deeper understanding.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reinterpretation of the play added a humorous twist to the performance.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, reinterpretation is a common practice to explore different artistic possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The reinterpretation of the recipe resulted in a delicious new dish that surprised everyone.
